Space Information

One million Earths could fit inside the sun – and the sun is considered an average-size star. For years it was believed that Earth was the only planet in our solar system with liquid water. More recently, NASA revealed its strongest evidence yet that there is intermittent running water on Mars, too Comets are leftovers from the creation of our solar system about 4.5 billion years ago – they consist of sand, ice and carbon dioxide. You wouldn’t be able to walk on Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus or Neptune because they have no solid surface! An asteroid about the size of a car enters Earth’s atmosphere roughly once a year – but it burns up before it reaches us. Phew! The highest mountain known to man is on an asteroid called Vesta. Measuring a whopping 22km in height, it is three times as tall as Mount Everest! There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on all the beaches on Earth. That’s at least a billion trillion! The sunset on Mars appears blue.

User Interface Designing and Testing 2022
